reviewText: BEVERLY HILLS CHIHUAHUA 3 is defintely a movie for young kids. Adults without kids may find this movie too silly to be enjoyable yet BEVERLY HILLS CHIHUAHUA 3 is full of charm and some humor for kids of all ages. Papi and Chloe are back with the kids and their "humans" have gotten a job in a very posh Beverly Hills hotel that caters to both humans and dogs.BEVERLY HILLS CHIHUAHUA 3 is good natured and fun. It does go overboard in camp with dogs in costumes acting and talking like humans. Of course, that is the charm of the film. There is also a good lesson here for kids about accepting others who are different. The lesson centers around little Rosa, who is the runt of her parents' litter. She is small in size but huge in heart and dedication and will prove that dogs of all sizes are equals.This would be a fun movie to watch with young kids. I imagine the joy and wonder they would experience watching dogs dressing and acting like humans. It is less appealing for adults alone but I had my share of chuckles. Certainly, the scene of Chloe doing a piano recital (and a darn fantastic one) in front of an audience was priceless--that scene alone was worth watching.Although this movie was direct to video, the quality is A+ and it seems like BEVERLY HILLS CHIHUAHUA 3 should have been a theatrical movie. Families are eager to find cute movies for their kids to see in theaters.BEVERLY HILLS CHIHUAHUA 3 is the perfect movie for kids and for families with young kids. This is a great movie for adults to enjoy with their young kids on family night.
summary: FUN MOVIE FOR KIDS AND FAMILIES
Title: N/A

reviewText: Papi, the main doggie, is going to party to celebrate friends and family. He and his canine friends move into a posh Beverly Hills hotel.  But Rosa, littlest member, feels less special.  Papi helps her find strength, more than she expected.  Funny, loving, exciting for the whole family. Cute movie
summary: A doggie movie about celebrating families

reviewText: This movie was totally funny!I'm a big-time fan of the original BHChichuahua, but I found part 2 lacking and forgettable. Part 3 is way better, almost as good as the original in terms of laughs, thanks in large part to newcomer scriptwriter Dana Starfield. There were certain music scenes that had me literally rolling on the floor with laughter, and a certain happy ending that appears halfway through the closing credits that had me in tears.I feel like a lot of effort was put into this sequal; I highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys the original.

reviewText: Disney sent this third installment straight to DVD probably realizing it wouldn't grab big box office numbers.  However, the series is popular with kids and you can see why---cute dogs, cute dogs and more cute dogs.  There's the necessary family values, bumbling villains, and prospects of doom avoided by eleventh hour heroics by the dogs.  It's all harmless fun and one can't help getting into the festivities.  The voice casting led by George Lopez and Odette Annable does well and the humans gracefully play second fiddle to the canine stars.Is BHC3 great film-making?  No---but its good family viewing.  A 4th entry is probably right around the corner.
